There are a few key things to consider when starting an ice cream business in New Zealand:

1. Research: Conduct market research to understand the current ice cream market in New Zealand, including trends, competition, and consumer preferences.
2. Develop a business plan: Use your research to develop a comprehensive business plan that outlines your goals, target market, and financial projections.
3. Develop your product: Create a unique and delicious product that stands out from the competition, using high-quality and natural ingredients.
4. Register your business and obtain licenses and permits: Register your business and obtain any necessary licenses and permits to operate in New Zealand.
5. Choose a location: Choose a location for your ice cream business, whether it's a storefront, a food truck, or a stand at a market or festival.
6. Create a branding and packaging: Develop a strong brand and packaging for your ice cream that will make it stand out and attract customers.
7. Develop a marketing strategy: Create a marketing strategy to promote your ice cream business and attract customers. This can include social media, advertising, and public relations.
8. Test your product: Test your product with a small group of customers before launching your business to get feedback and make any necessary adjustments.
9. Prepare for the launch: Prepare for the launch of your business by ordering equipment, hiring staff, and stocking up on ingredients.

Remember, starting a business can be challenging, but with the right preparation, planning and execution, it can be a very rewarding experience.
